revised_title: The Influence of Stress and Strain on the Electrical Conductivity of Metals
tldr: The author investigates the effects of stress and strain on the electrical conductivity of cobalt, magnesium, steel, and platinum-iridium. They find that mechanical stress can significantly alter the specific electrical resistance of these metals, with iron and nickel showing the most noticeable changes. This research contributes to the understanding of the relationship between mechanical stress and electrical properties in metals.
